thread.title: Pocono Sports Roundup: Brigante, Mickens pace Panthers to win
thread.title_full: Pocono Sports Roundup: Brigante, Mickens pace Panthers to win

author: Staff reports
title: Pocono Sports Roundup: Brigante, Mickens pace Panthers to win
text: Cross country Mounties finish first BETHLEHEM - Allana Powllette led Stroudsburg to a first place finish in the girls White Division at the Paul Short Invitational last week at Lehigh University. Powellete finished 6th overall with a time of 19:20, Amy Conboy was 9th (19:41) and Michelle Joyce finished 15th at 19:55. In the boys meet, Teddy Mostellar finished 10th with a time of 16:44 for Stroudsburg. Hall of Fame Pocono Mountain inductees SWIFTWATER - The Pocono Mountain East Booster Club will induct Brad Pensyl, William Nish, Dawn DelGuidice, Vanessa VanDeVenter Halloran and Joe Palowski into the PM Cardinals Hall of Fame on Saturday night. Pensyl coached the Cardinals' basketball team for 13 years compiling a 224-117 record. He qualified for district playoffs all 13 years and won a championship in 1992 (first in school history). Nish, a 1,000 point scorer, made all-league three times in basketball and was a three-year starter in soccer. DelGuidice was a four-year starter in girls soccer and was part of the 1993 championship team that finished 19-0. She was a four-year letter winner in swimming where she set school records in the 4x100 and 4x200. Palowski was a 1,000 yard rusher in football and currently ranks fourth all time in touchdowns. VanDeVenter Halloran was a four-year varsity starter in volleyball, soccer and basketball. She belongs to the 1,000 point and 1,000 rebound club in girls basketball. All-conference soccer player. The inductees will also be honored on Friday night at the Pocono Mountain East and Stroudsburg football game in Swiftwater. Rec golf Hole in one - Eric Sandwall made a hole in one on No. 6 at Pinecrest Lake Golf Club on Wednesday from 145 yards out using a 4-hybrid. Al Seger, Mike Menche and Gary Kapostas witnessed the shot. College football Schnaars named Offensive Player of the Week EAST STROUDSBURG - East Stroudsburg University redshirt senior wide receiver Jon Schnaars has been named the D2Football.com Offensive Player of the Week for his record-setting performance in Saturday’s five-overtime game vs. Shippensburg. Schnaars (Harrisburg, Pa./Central Dauphin) had 20 catches for 218 yards and seven touchdowns, setting PSAC records for both receptions and touchdown catches, as Shippensburg prevailed 69-67 (5OT), tied for the longest game in PSAC history. Schnaars’ seven receiving TD are one shy of the DII record (8) set by Paul Zaeske (North Park) vs. North Central in 1968. His seven total TD are the most in DII since running back Bernard Scott (Abilene Christian) had seven vs. West Texas A&M in 2008. He had the ninth game with 20+ catches in DII history. Schnaars had 17 catches for 201 yards and four TD in regulation, and had three catches - all for TD - in overtime, scoring three of ESU’s four TD in the extra sessions. He is the sixth ESU player to be named D2Football.com Offensive Player of the Week since the 2006 season, joining wide receiver Evan Prall (2006 vs. Lock Haven), quarterback Jimmy Terwilliger (2006 vs. California, at Bloomsburg and vs. Kutztown), quarterback Matt Marshall (2008 at Millersville), quarterback Ray Wagner (2011 at Kutztown) and Soltes (2012 at LIU Post, 2014 at Shippensburg. College field hockey ESU 11, Mansfield 0 EAST STROUDSBURG - Senior forward Ally Roth and junior back Emily Howell both scored two goals as No. 3-ranked East Stroudsburg University posted an 11-0 win vs. Mansfield in PSAC field hockey on Wednesday afternoon at Whitenight Field. ESU (9-2, 4-0) led 6-0 at halftime en route to its sixth straight win. Senior midfielder Rebecca Snyder, junior forward Marisa Miro, junior forward Sabrina Burke, junior midfielder Desiraye Mack, freshman forward Tiffany Regman, freshman forward Kelli Shapiro and senior back Amanda Wnorowski also scored for the Warriors. Wnorowski, Regman and Shapiro all had their first career goals. ESU scored double-figure goals for the fourth time in 991 games in program history. The 11 goals are tied for the second-most in school history. ESU beat Hunter College, 16-0, in 1962, Catawba, 11-0, in 2001, and Moravian, 10-0, in 1950. ESU is at Seton Hill (0-10, 0-4) on Saturday. The Warriors host No. 1 Millersville, currently 12-0 (5-0) after a 1-0 OT win vs. No. 4 Shippensburg, on Tuesday, Oct. 13. Men's soccer Caldwell 2, ESU 1 (2OT) EAST STROUDSBURG - Tom Yorston scored on an assist from Jakub Havlak 3:07 into the second overtime, giving Caldwell a 2-1 (2OT) win over East Stroudsburg University in non-conference men’s soccer on Wednesday night at Eiler-Martin Stadium. Caldwell opened the scoring in the 18th minute with a goal by Sam Odell, and ESU tied it at 1-1 in the 51st minute as sophomore back Keelby Espinola headed in a 45-yard free kick taken by sophomore forward Christian Bukowski. The goal was the first of Espinola’s career and Bukowski notched his fifth assist of the season and the 10th of his career. He entered the week as the only PSAC player with at least four goals (6) and four assists. ESU had two shots in the first overtime, and Caldwell scored on its only shot in the overtime sessions. ESU had a 15-12 advantage in shots overall and 7-6 in shots on goal. ESU (5-6, 2-4) hosts Slippery Rock (7-4, 3-3) in PSAC action on Saturday at 3:30 p.m. Today's Sports Pleasant Valley at PM East, 3:30 p.m. PM West at ES North, 3:30 p.m. ES South at Stroudsburg, 3:30 p.m. VOLLEYBALL Pleasant Valley at ES South, 3:30 p.m. PM East at ES North, 4:45 p.m. Stroudsburg at PM West, 5:30 p.m. FOOTBALL Stroudsburg at PM East, 7 p.m. Bethlehem Catholic at ES North, 7 p.m. Pleasant Valley at ES South, 7 p.m. BOYS SOCCER Notre Dame GP at Notre Dame ES, 3:30 p.m. By Staff reports
